p: Many terms are used to describe this condition since the pathological findings are highly variable, such as vertebral abscess, vertebral osteomyelitis or spinal abscess. Osteomyelitis is relatively frequent in young pigs and a few bacterial species have been postulated to be the causative agents. To the authorsâ€™ knowledge, this is the first report that describes MRI findings in vertebral osteomyelitis in a pig potentially caused by A. pleuropneumoniae.
